title: Software Engineer
whatTheyDo:
Software engineers design, develop, and maintain software applications and systems. They write code, test software, and collaborate with teams to create solutions that meet user needs. Software engineers work across various industries, from web development to mobile apps, enterprise software, and embedded systems.

Software engineers typically do the following: analyze user needs and software requirements, design software solutions and system architecture, write and test code in various programming languages, debug and fix software issues, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and maintain and update existing software systems.
requiredSkills: Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.)
Understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum)
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Understanding of software architecture and design patterns

relatedCareers.title: Data Scientist
relatedCareers.description: Analyzes complex data to drive business decisions.

relatedCareers.title: Web Developer
relatedCareers.description: Builds and maintains websites and web applications.

title: Mechanical Engineer
tagline: Designs and builds machines and systems.
whatTheyDo:
Mechanical engineers design, develop, build, and test mechanical and thermal sensors and devices, including tools, engines, and machines. They work on power-producing machines such as electric generators, internal combustion engines, and steam and gas turbines, as well as power-using machines such as refrigeration and air-conditioning systems.

Mechanical engineers typically do the following: analyze problems to see how mechanical and thermal devices might help solve a particular problem, design or redesign mechanical and thermal devices or subsystems, using analysis and computer-aided design, develop and test prototypes of devices they design, analyze the test results and change the design or system as needed, and oversee the manufacturing process for the device.
requiredSkills: Understanding of thermodynamics and fluid mechanics

videos.title: A Day in the Life of a Mechanical Engineer
videos.name: Sarah Martinez

relatedCareers.title: Aerospace Engineer
relatedCareers.description: Designs aircraft, spacecraft, and related systems.

title: Data Scientist
whatTheyDo:
Data scientists analyze complex data sets to extract meaningful insights and help organizations make data-driven decisions. They use statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and programming skills to process and interpret large amounts of data.

Data scientists typically do the following: collect and clean large datasets, perform statistical analysis and data mining, build predictive models using machine learning, create data visualizations and reports, communicate findings to stakeholders, and work with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.
requiredSkills: Understanding of databases and data warehousing

relatedCareers.title: Financial Analyst
relatedCareers.description: Analyzes financial data and market trends.

title: Biomedical Engineer
whatTheyDo:
Biomedical engineers combine engineering principles with medical and biological sciences to design and create equipment, devices, computer systems, and software used in healthcare. They work on a wide range of medical technologies, from artificial organs to imaging systems and drug delivery systems.

Biomedical engineers typically do the following: design medical devices and equipment, conduct research to develop new medical technologies, test and evaluate medical equipment, collaborate with healthcare professionals, ensure compliance with medical regulations, and maintain and repair medical equipment.
requiredSkills: Strong foundation in biology and chemistry
Knowledge of medical devices and systems
Understanding of human anatomy and physiology

relatedCareers.title: Clinical Engineer
relatedCareers.description: Manages medical equipment in healthcare settings.

title: Nurse Practitioner
whatTheyDo:
Nurse practitioners (NPs) are advanced practice registered nurses who provide primary and specialty healthcare. They can diagnose and treat medical conditions, prescribe medications, and provide patient education. NPs work in various settings including hospitals, clinics, private practices, and community health centers.

Nurse practitioners typically do the following: assess patients and diagnose health conditions, develop and implement treatment plans, prescribe medications and therapies, order and interpret diagnostic tests, provide patient education and counseling, collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals, and maintain patient records.
requiredSkills: Knowledge of human anatomy and physiology

relatedCareers.title: Registered Nurse
relatedCareers.description: Provides direct patient care and coordinates treatment.

relatedCareers.title: Physician Assistant
relatedCareers.description: Provides medical care under physician supervision.

title: Environmental Scientist
whatTheyDo:
Environmental scientists study the environment and develop solutions to environmental problems. They conduct research, collect and analyze data, and develop plans to prevent or fix environmental issues. They work in various settings including government agencies, consulting firms, and research institutions.

Environmental scientists typically do the following: collect and analyze environmental samples, conduct field investigations and surveys, develop plans to prevent or fix environmental problems, prepare technical reports and presentations, ensure compliance with environmental regulations, collaborate with government agencies and organizations, and monitor environmental quality and pollution levels.
requiredSkills: Knowledge of environmental regulations and policies
Field research and data collection abilities
Understanding of chemistry, biology, and earth sciences
Proficiency in data analysis and GIS software

title: Financial Analyst
whatTheyDo:
Financial analysts evaluate investment opportunities, analyze financial data, and provide recommendations to help individuals and organizations make financial decisions. They work in various settings including banks, investment firms, insurance companies, and corporate finance departments.

Financial analysts typically do the following: analyze financial statements and market trends, evaluate investment opportunities, create financial models and forecasts, prepare reports and presentations, provide recommendations to clients or management, monitor economic and market conditions, and assess the financial health of companies or investments.
requiredSkills: Understanding of financial markets and instruments
Proficiency in financial analysis and modeling

relatedCareers.title: Investment Banker
relatedCareers.description: Helps companies raise capital and execute transactions.

relatedCareers.title: Financial Planner
relatedCareers.description: Helps individuals plan for financial goals.

title: Project Manager
tagline: Leads teams to successful project delivery.
whatTheyDo:
Project managers plan, execute, and close projects while managing resources, timelines, and stakeholders. They work across all industries to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet quality standards.

Project managers typically do the following: define project scope and objectives, develop project plans and timelines, allocate resources and manage budgets, coordinate team members and stakeholders, monitor project progress and performance, identify and manage risks, and ensure project deliverables meet quality standards.
requiredSkills: Understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall)

title: Marketing Manager
whatTheyDo:
Marketing managers plan, develop, and execute marketing strategies to promote products, services, or brands. They work to understand customer needs, develop marketing campaigns, and measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts. Marketing managers work across various industries and may specialize in digital marketing, brand management, or product marketing.

Marketing managers typically do the following: develop marketing strategies and campaigns, conduct market research and analyze consumer behavior, manage marketing budgets and resources, coordinate with creative teams and agencies, measure and analyze marketing performance, develop brand positioning and messaging, and oversee marketing team members.
requiredSkills: Understanding of marketing principles and strategies
Digital marketing knowledge (SEO, social media, email)
